identificationModule.briefTitle: Electric Field Navigated 1hz Rtms for Post-stroke Motor Recovery Trial
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Prospective, Multi-center, Randomized, Sham-controlled Trial to Determine the Therapeutic Effects of Navigation Guided 1 hz Rtms Administered to the Contralesional Hemisphere as Adjuvant to Task-oriented Rehabilitation in Patients With Ischemic Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A prospective, multi-center, randomized, sham-controlled, blinded study combining active Nexstim NBS-guided 1Hz rTMS or sham-rTMS targeting the healthy hemisphere with standardized task oriented rehabilitation will be conducted in patients with post-stroke motor impairment of the upper limb. The therapy will be provided for 6 weeks and primary outcome assessed 6 months later.

primaryOutcomes.description: Range 0 to 65. HIgher scores indicate better function. Minimal clinically important difference = change of 5 points or more on scale. Outcome measure = proportion of patients in treatment arm gaining at least 5 points on scale between baseline and 6 months after end of treatment.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline to 6 months after end of treatment.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Range 0-65. HIgher scores indicate better function.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change in score from baseline to 6 months after end of treatment

secondaryOutcomes.description: Range 0 to 57. Higher scores indicate better function.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change in score from baseline to 6 months after end of treatment.

secondaryOutcomes.description: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale - Motor Arm. Range 0 to 4. Lower score indicates better function.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change in score from baseline to 6 months after end of treatment

secondaryOutcomes.description: EuroQoL - EQ-5D score. Range 0 to 100. HIgher numbers indicate better quality of life.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change in score from baseline to 6 months after end of treatment
